pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [x] depends on: #13950
- [x] depends on: #15813
- [x] depends on: #15814
- [x] depends on: #16940

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Please also make sure your title follows our community convention: https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/commit.html
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11124678387/job/30910726047)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11124678387/job/30910726784)

Thanks!

LGTM, just one question.

bors d+

Thanks!

LGTM, just one question.

bors d+
I'm slightly surprised `gcongr` can't figure this one out, it's just an assumption right?

Yes but it's not in a position where `gcongr` would look for an assumption. Instead it's a position where `gcongr` calls `positivity`, but only once you import `Tactic.GCongr`. If you only import, `Tactic.GCongr.Core`, then it doesn't try to discharge.
Then it sounds to me like `Tactic.GCongr` should be imported, since we'd like to discharge the positivity assumption!

```suggestion
`g`, which antivary together on `s`, is unchanged by a permutation if and only if `f` and `g ‚àò œÉ` antivary
```
and similar below

Is there a reason this is in the `Mul` section but the earlier versions are not in the `SMul` section? The `mul` version of these lemmas is obviously informally more useful - what is the reason for the inconsistency here?
Oversight
Instead of unfolding the definition of subset here, you can use a lemma in mathlib: `Finset.subset_univ`
Doesn't work :-) the LHS is a `Set`

For readability's sake, let's be consistent about the layout of the arguments in this file. In some lemmas you put the Monovary assumption on the next line, and in others on the same line - please be consistent here.
That was an oversight
Is it easier to get this by dualising `MonovaryOn.sum_comp_perm_smul_le_sum_smul` instead of inverting sigma?
Orthogonal to this PR: it would be nice to have the additional version of the equality case that if `g` is injective, then equality happens iff sigma is the identity
I've added a todo
Why is this necessary?
It was necessary at some point for some reason, but it looks it's not anymore

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: Generalise the rearrangement inequality
